Article Title: 'Never looked at personal gain': Eknath Shinde praises Raj Thackeray for 'helping hand' in Kalyan-Dombivli
Article Text:
Deputy CM Eknath Shinde praised MNS chief Raj Thackeray, five of whose corporators have backed Shinde Sena in KDMC

“Democracy Sliding Into ICU”: Opposition Targets BJP As BMC Polls Trigger Political Storm







MUMBAI: Deputy CM Eknath Shinde praised MNS chief Raj Thackeray , five of whose corporators have backed Shinde Sena in KDMC, saying Raj has never looked at personal gain and has always taken decisions from a broader perspective.Shinde said, “MNS has supported Shiv Sena for development in Kalyan-Dombivli. Earlier too, MNS was with us (Mahayuti) in LS and assembly elections. The alliance of BJP and Shiv Sena is not just for now. Now MNS has also participated in it. We are seeing who benefited and who lost from the (UBT Sena-MNS) alliance, Raj has never looked at personal gain."He has always taken decisions from a broader perspective. He had supported PM Modi on development. He had also supported us in the assembly elections. Raj Thackeray values feelings of his workers,” Shinde added further.Shinde said there was no tussle between Sena and BJP over the mayor’s post in BMC and added the mayor will be from Mahayuti. In a dig at Sena (UBT), he said those who don’t have numbers must not dream of getting their mayor elected. Observers said Shinde seems to have conceded BMC mayor’s post to BJP as he has been talking of a Mahayuti mayor.Referring to Kalyan-Dombivli, Shinde said Sena and BJP won’t stay away from each other in power there.
Article Summary: Shinde said there was no tussle between Sena and BJP over the mayor’s post in BMC and added the mayor will be from Mahayuti. In a dig at Sena (UBT), he said those who don’t have numbers must not dream of getting their mayor elected.

Article Title: Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Sha in Colonel Sofiya Qureshi row named Republic Day event chief guest
Article Text: INDORE: A decision by MP govt to name minister Vijay Shah as chief guest for a Republic Day flag-hoisting ceremony in Ratlam has sparked a row.Congress has objected to the move citing Shah’s controversial remarks against Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, involved in Operation Sindoor press briefing, and SC’s subsequent scrutiny.“Responsibility of hoisting the Tricolour in Ratlam is being given to a minister like Vijay Shah, who used indecent and insulting words against the daughter of the country and brave Indian Army officer Colonel Sophia Qureshi,” Congress state spokesperson Santosh Gautam said. He highlighted SC’s intervention to set adeadline for the govt on prosecution sanction for Shah.BJP defended the govt’s decision while acknowledging ongoing investigations.“Govt has itself taken note of Shah’s statement and constituted an SIT,” state party spokesperson Yashpal Singh Sisodiya said, adding the SIT is scheduled to submit its reply to the top court within two weeks.
Article Summary: MP govt to name minister Vijay Shah as chief guest for a Republic Day flag- hoisting ceremony in Ratlam. Congress has objected to the move citing Shah’s controversial remarks against Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, involved in Operation Sindoor press briefing.
